flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1020>>1020
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1020 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1020 = $<<2500-1020=1480>>1480
He wants to put half of $1480 into a retirement account so he will invest 1480/2= $<<1480/2=740>>740 into his retirement account
He had 1480 and puts $740 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 1480-740 = $<<1480-740=740>>740 remaining
#### 740

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 1020. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
